summary.para: Enables or disables a button.

param.name: hwndCtl
param.para: A handle to the button control.

param.name: fEnable
param.para: TRUE to enable the button, or FALSE to disable it.

summary.para: Gets the check state of a radio button or check box. You can use this macro or send the BM_GETCHECK message explicitly.

param.name: hwndCtl
param.para: A handle to the button control.

remarks.para: If the button has a style other than those listed, the return value is zero.

summary.para: Retrieves the state of a button or check box. You can use this macro or send the BM_GETSTATE message explicitly.

param.name: hwndCtl
param.para: A handle to the button control.

summary.para: Gets the text of a button.

param.name: hwndCtl
param.para: A handle to the button control.

param.name: lpch
param.para: Pointer to the buffer that will receive the text.

param.name: cchMax
param.para: The maximum number of characters to copy to the buffer, including the NULL terminator.

remarks.para: The macro expands to a call to .

summary.para: Gets the number of characters in the text of a button.

param.name: hwndCtl
param.para: A handle to the button control.

remarks.para: The macro expands to a call to .

summary.para: Sets the check state of a radio button or check box. You can use this macro or send the BM_SETCHECK message explicitly.

param.name: hwndCtl
param.para: A handle to the button control.

param.name: check
param.para: The check state. This parameter can be one of the following values.

description.para: Sets the button state to checked.
Sets the button state to grayed, indicating an indeterminate state. Use this value only if the button has the BS_3STATE or BS_AUTO3STATE style.
Sets the button state to cleared.

remarks.para: The macro has no effect on push buttons.

summary.para: Sets the highlight state of a button. The highlight state indicates whether the button is highlighted as if the user had pushed it. You can use this macro or send the BM_SETSTATE message explicitly.

param.name: hwndCtl
param.para: A handle to the button control.

param.name: state
param.para: TRUE to highlight the button; otherwise FALSE.

remarks.para: Highlighting affects only the appearance of a button. It has no effect on the check state of a radio button or check box.
A button is automatically highlighted when the user positions the cursor over it and presses and holds the left mouse button. The highlighting is removed when the user releases the mouse button.

summary.para: Sets the style of a button. You can use this macro or send the BM_SETSTYLE message explicitly.

param.name: hwndCtl
param.para: A handle to the button control.

param.name: style
param.para: The button style. This parameter can be a combination of button styles. For a table of button styles, see Button Styles.

param.name: fRedraw
param.para: TRUE to redraw the button; otherwise FALSE.

summary.para: Sets the text of a button.

param.name: hwndCtl
param.para: A handle to the button control.

param.name: lpsz
param.para: A pointer to a null-terminated string to be used as the button text.

remarks.para: The macro expands to a call to .

summary.para: Adds item data to the list in a combo box at the specified location. You can use this macro or send the CB_ADDSTRING message explicitly.

param.name: data
param.para: A pointer to the item data to add.

remarks.para: Use this macro for a list in a combo box with an owner-drawn style but without the CBS_HASSTRINGS style. For more information, see CB_ADDSTRING.

summary.para: Adds a string to a list in a combo box. If the combo box does not have the CBS_SORT style, the string is added to the end of the list. Otherwise, the string is inserted into the list and the list is sorted. You can use this macro or send the CB_ADDSTRING message explicitly.
Deletes the item at the specified location in a list in a combo box. You can use this macro or send the CB_DELETESTRING message explicitly.

param.name: index
param.para: The zero-based index of the item to delete.

summary.para: Adds names to the list displayed by a combo box. The macro adds the names of directories and files that match a specified string and set of file attributes. It can also add mapped drive letters to the list in a combo box. You can use this macro or send the CB_DIR message explicitly.

param.name: attrs
param.para: The attributes of the files or directories to be added to the list in a combo box. For more information, see CB_DIR.

param.name: lpszFileSpec
param.para: A pointer to the null-terminated string that specifies an absolute path, relative path, or filename. An absolute path can begin with a drive letter (for example, d:) or a UNC name (for example, \ machinename\ sharename).

summary.para: Enables or disables a combo box control.

param.name: fEnable
param.para: TRUE to enable the control, or FALSE to disable it.

summary.para: Finds the first item in a combo box list that has the specified item data. You can use this macro or send the CB_FINDSTRING message explicitly.

param.name: indexStart
param.para: The zero-based index of the item before the first item to be searched. When the search reaches the bottom of the list, it continues searching from the top of the list back to the item specified by the indexStart parameter. If indexStart is –1, the entire list is searched from the beginning.

summary.para: Finds the first string in a combo box list that begins with the specified string. You can use this macro or send the CB_FINDSTRING message explicitly.

param.name: indexStart
param.para: The zero-based index of the item before the first item to be searched. When the search reaches the bottom of the list, it continues searching from the top of the list back to the item specified by the indexStart parameter. If indexStart is –1, the entire list is searched from the beginning.

summary.para: Finds the first string in a combo box list that exactly matches the specified string, except that the search is not case sensitive. You can use this macro or send the CB_FINDSTRINGEXACT message explicitly.

param.name: indexStart
param.para: The zero-based index of the item before the first item to be searched. When the search reaches the bottom of the list, it continues searching from the top of the list back to the item specified by the indexStart parameter. If indexStart is –1, the entire list is searched from the beginning.

summary.para: Gets the number of items in the list box of a combo box. You can use this macro or send the CB_GETCOUNT message explicitly.
Gets the index of the currently selected item in a combo box. You can use this macro or send the CB_GETCURSEL message explicitly.
Retrieves the screen coordinates of a combo box in its dropped-down state. You can use this macro or send the CB_GETDROPPEDCONTROLRECT message explicitly.

param.name: lprc
param.para: A pointer to a structure that receives the coordinates of the combo box in its dropped-down state.

summary.para: Ascertains whether the drop list in a combo box control is visible. You can use this macro or send the CB_GETDROPPEDSTATE message explicitly.

param.name: hwndCtl
param.para: A handle to the combo box control.

summary.para: Ascertains whether a combo box is using the default user interface (UI) or the extended UI. You can use this macro or send the CB_GETEXTENDEDUI message explicitly.
Gets the application-defined value associated with the specified list item in a combo box. You can use this macro or send the CB_GETITEMDATA message explicitly.

param.name: index
param.para: The zero-based index of the item.

summary.para: Retrieves the height of list items in a combo box. You can use this macro or send the CB_GETITEMHEIGHT message explicitly.

remarks.para: This macro passes zero as the wParam member of . For more information, see CB_GETITEMHEIGHT.

summary.para: Gets a string from a list in a combo box. You can use this macro or send the CB_GETLBTEXT message explicitly.

param.name: index
param.para: The zero-based index of the item.

param.name: lpszBuffer
param.para: A pointer to the buffer that will receive the string. The buffer must have sufficient space for the string and a terminating null character. Before allocating the buffer, you can call to retrieve the length of the string.

summary.para: Gets the length of a string in the list in a combo box. You can use this macro or send the CB_GETLBTEXTLEN message explicitly.

param.name: index
param.para: The zero-based index of the item.

summary.para: Retrieves the text from a combo box control.

param.name: lpch
param.para: A pointer to the buffer that will receive the text.

param.name: cchMax
param.para: The maximum number of characters to copy to the buffer, including the NULL terminator.

remarks.para: The macro expands to a call to .

summary.para: Gets the number of characters in the text of a combo box.

remarks.para: The macro expands to a call to .

summary.para: Inserts item data in a list in a combo box at the specified location. You can use this macro or send the CB_INSERTSTRING message explicitly.

param.name: index
param.para: The zero-based index in the list at which to insert the item data, or –1 to add it to the end of the list.

remarks.para: Use this macro for a list in a combo box with an owner-drawn style but without the CBS_HASSTRINGS style. For more information, see CB_INSERTSTRING.

summary.para: Adds a string to a list in a combo box at the specified location. You can use this macro or send the CB_INSERTSTRING message explicitly.

param.name: index
param.para: The zero-based index at which to insert the string, or –1 to add it to the end of the list.

summary.para: Limits the length of the text the user may type into the edit control of a combo box. You can use this macro or send the CB_LIMITTEXT message explicitly.
Removes all items from the list box and edit control of a combo box. You can use this macro or send the CB_RESETCONTENT message explicitly.
Searches a list in a combo box for an item that has the specified item data. If a matching item is found, the item is selected. You can use this macro or send the CB_SELECTSTRING message explicitly.

param.name: indexStart
param.para: The zero-based index of the item before the first item to be searched. When the search reaches the bottom of the list, it continues searching from the top of the list back to the item specified by the indexStart parameter. If indexStart is –1, the entire list is searched from the beginning.

summary.para: Searches a list in a combo box for an item that begins with the characters in a specified string. If a matching item is found, the item is selected. You can use this macro or send the CB_SELECTSTRING message explicitly.

param.name: indexStart
param.para: The zero-based index of the item before the first item to be searched. When the search reaches the bottom of the list, it continues searching from the top of the list back to the item specified by the indexStart parameter. If indexStart is –1, the entire list is searched from the beginning.

summary.para: Sets the currently selected item in a combo box. You can use this macro or send the CB_SETCURSEL message explicitly.

param.name: index
param.para: The zero-based index of the item to select, or –1 to clear the selection.

summary.para: Selects either the default user interface (UI) or the extended UI for a combo box that has the CBS_DROPDOWN or CBS_DROPDOWNLIST style. You can use this macro or send the CB_SETEXTENDEDUI message explicitly.

param.name: flags
param.para: Zero to use the default UI, or nonzero to use the extended UI.

summary.para: Sets the application-defined value associated with the specified list item in a combo box. You can use this macro or send the CB_SETITEMDATA message explicitly.

param.name: index
param.para: The zero-based index of the item.

summary.para: Sets the height of list items or the selection field in a combo box. You can use this macro or send the CB_SETITEMHEIGHT message explicitly.

param.name: index
param.para: The component of the combo box for which to set the height. This parameter must be –1 to set the height of the selection field. It must be zero to set the height of list items, unless the combo box has the CBS_OWNERDRAWVARIABLE style. In that case, the index parameter is the zero-based index of a specific list item.

summary.para: Sets the text of a combo box.

param.name: lpsz
param.para: A pointer to a null-terminated string to be used as the control text.

remarks.para: The macro expands to a call to .

summary.para: Shows or hides the list in a combo box. You can use this macro or send the CB_SHOWDROPDOWN message explicitly.

param.name: fShow
param.para: TRUE to show the dropdown, or FALSE to hide it.

remarks.para: This macro has no effect on a combo box created with the CBS_SIMPLE style.

summary.para: The DeleteFont macro deletes a font object, freeing all system resources associated with the font object.

param.name: hfont
param.para: A handle to the font object.

remarks.para: After the font object is deleted, the specified handle is no longer valid.
The DeleteFont macro is equivalent to calling as follows:

summary.para: Determines whether there are any actions in the undo queue of an edit or rich edit control. You can use this macro or send the EM_CANUNDO message explicitly.

Resets the undo flag of an edit or rich edit control. The undo flag is set whenever an operation within the edit control can be undone. You can use this macro or send the EM_EMPTYUNDOBUFFER message explicitly.
Enables or disables an edit control.

param.name: hwndCtl
param.para: A handle to the edit control.

param.name: fEnable
param.para: TRUE to enable the control, or FALSE to disable it.

summary.para: Sets a flag that determines whether text retrieved from a multiline edit control includes soft line-break characters. A soft line break consists of two carriage returns and a line feed and is inserted at the end of a line that is broken because of word wrapping. You can use this macro or send the EM_FMTLINES message explicitly.

param.name: fAddEOL
param.para: TRUE to insert line breaks; otherwise FALSE.

summary.para: Gets the index of the uppermost visible line in a multiline edit or rich edit control. You can use this macro or send the EM_GETFIRSTVISIBLELINE message explicitly.
Gets a handle to the memory currently allocated for the text of a multiline edit control. You can use this macro or send the EM_GETHANDLE message explicitly.
Retrieves a line of text from an edit or rich edit control. You can use this macro or send the EM_GETLINE message explicitly.

param.name: line
param.para: The zero-based index of the line. This parameter is ignored by a single-line edit control.

param.name: lpch
param.para: A pointer to a buffer that receives the string.

param.name: cchMax
param.para: The maximum number of characters to be copied to the buffer.

summary.para: Gets the number of lines in the text of an edit control. You can use this macro or send the EM_GETLINECOUNT message explicitly.

Gets the state of an edit or rich edit control's modification flag. The flag indicates whether the contents of the control have been modified. You can use this macro or send the EM_GETMODIFY message explicitly.
Gets the password character for an edit or rich edit control. You can use this macro or send the EM_GETPASSWORDCHAR message explicitly.
Gets the formatting rectangle of an edit control. You can use this macro or send the EM_GETRECT message explicitly.

param.name: lprc
param.para: A pointer to a structure that receives the formatting rectangle.

summary.para: Gets the starting and ending character positions of the current selection in an edit or rich edit control. You can use this macro or send the EM_GETSEL message explicitly.

remarks.para: This macro does not have the complete functionality of the EM_GETSEL message, because it does not receive the 32-bit return values in the parameters of .

summary.para: Gets the text of an edit control.

param.name: hwndCtl
param.para: A handle to the edit control.

param.name: lpch
param.para: A pointer to the buffer that will receive the text.

param.name: cchMax
param.para: The maximum number of characters to copy to the buffer, including the NULL terminator.

remarks.para: The macro expands to a call to .

summary.para: Gets the number of characters in the text of an edit control.

remarks.para: The macro expands to a call to .

summary.para: Retrieves the address of an edit or rich edit control's Wordwrap function. You can use this macro or send the EM_GETWORDBREAKPROC message explicitly.
Limits the length of text that can be entered into an edit control. You can use this macro or send the EM_LIMITTEXT message explicitly.
Gets the index of the line that contains the specified character index in a multiline edit or rich edit control. You can use this macro or send the EM_LINEFROMCHAR message explicitly.

param.name: ich
param.para: The zero-based index of the character from the beginning of the text in the control.

summary.para: Gets the character index of the first character of a specified line in a multiline edit or rich edit control. You can use this macro or send the EM_LINEINDEX message explicitly.

param.name: line
param.para: The zero-based line number. A value of –1 specifies the current line number (the line that contains the caret).

summary.para: Retrieves the length, in characters, of a line in an edit or rich edit control. You can use this macro or send the EM_LINELENGTH message explicitly.

param.name: line
param.para: The zero-based index of the line.

summary.para: Replaces the selected text in an edit control or a rich edit control with the specified text. You can use this macro or send the EM_REPLACESEL message explicitly.

param.name: lpszReplace
param.para: A pointer to a null-terminated string containing the replacement text.

summary.para: Scrolls the text vertically in a multiline edit or rich edit control. You can use this macro or send the EM_SCROLL message explicitly.
Scrolls the caret into view in an edit or rich edit control. You can use this macro or send the EM_SCROLLCARET message explicitly.
Sets the handle of the memory that will be used by a multiline edit control. You can use this macro or send the EM_SETHANDLE message explicitly.

param.name: h
param.para: A handle to the memory buffer the edit control uses to store the currently displayed text instead of allocating its own memory. If necessary, the control reallocates this memory.

summary.para: Sets or clears the modification flag for an edit control. The modification flag indicates whether the text within the edit control has been modified. You can use this macro or send the EM_SETMODIFY message explicitly.

param.name: fModified
param.para: TRUE if the text has been modified; otherwise FALSE.

summary.para: Sets or removes the password character for an edit or rich edit control. When a password character is set, that character is displayed in place of the characters typed by the user. You can use this macro or send the EM_SETPASSWORDCHAR message explicitly.

param.name: ch
param.para: The character to be displayed in place of the characters typed by the user. If this parameter is zero, the control removes the current password character and displays the characters typed by the user.

summary.para: Sets or removes the read-only style (ES_READONLY) of an edit or rich edit control. You can use this macro or send the EM_SETREADONLY message explicitly.

param.name: fReadOnly
param.para: TRUE to set the control to read-only; FALSE to remove the read-only style.

summary.para: Sets the formatting rectangle of an edit control. You can use this macro or send the EM_SETRECT message explicitly.

param.name: lprc
param.para: A pointer to a structure that specifies the new dimensions of the rectangle. If this parameter is NULL, the formatting rectangle is set to its default values.

summary.para: Sets the formatting rectangle of a multiline edit control. This macro is equivalent to , except that it does not redraw the edit control window. You can use this macro or send the EM_SETRECTNP message explicitly.

param.name: lprc
param.para: A pointer to a structure that specifies the dimensions of the rectangle. If this parameter is NULL, the formatting rectangle is set to its default values.

remarks.para: Rich Edit 3.0 and later. This macro does not have full functionality, because it does not set the WPARAM of the message.

summary.para: Selects a range of characters in an edit or rich edit control. You can use this macro or send the EM_SETSEL message explicitly.

param.name: ichStart
param.para: The starting character position of the selection.

param.name: ichEnd
param.para: The ending character position of the selection.

summary.para: Sets the tab stops in a multiline edit or rich edit control. When text is copied to the control, any tab character in the text causes space to be generated up to the next tab stop. You can use this macro or send the EM_SETTABSTOPS message explicitly.

param.name: cTabs
param.para: The number of tab stops contained in the array. If this parameter is zero, the lpTabs parameter is ignored and default tab stops are set at every 32 dialog template units. If this parameter is 1, tab stops are set at every n dialog template units, where n is the distance pointed to by the lpTabs parameter. If this parameter is greater than 1, lpTabs is a pointer to an array of tab stops.

param.name: lpTabs
param.para: A pointer to an array of unsigned integers specifying the tab stops, in dialog template units. If cTabs is 1, this parameter is a pointer to an unsigned integer containing the distance between all tab stops, in dialog template units.

summary.para: Sets the text of an edit control.

param.name: lpsz
param.para: A pointer to a null-terminated string to be set as the text in the control.

remarks.para: The macro expands to a call to .

summary.para: Replaces an edit control's default Wordwrap function with an application-defined Wordwrap function. You can use this macro or send the EM_SETWORDBREAKPROC message explicitly.

param.name: lpfnWordBreak
param.para: The address of the application-defined Wordwrap function. For more information about breaking lines, see the description of the EditWordBreakProc callback function.

summary.para: Undoes the last operation in the undo queue of an edit or rich edit control. You can use this macro or send the EM_UNDO message explicitly.
Retrieves the signed x-coordinate from the specified LPARAM value.

param.name: lp
param.para: The data from which the x-coordinate is to be extracted.

remarks.para: Use GET_X_LPARAM instead of LOWORD to extract signed coordinate data. Negative screen coordinates may be returned on multiple monitor systems.

summary.para: Retrieves the signed y-coordinate from the given LPARAM value.

param.name: lp
param.para: The data from which the y-coordinate is to be extracted.

remarks.para: Use GET_Y_LPARAM instead of HIWORD to extract signed coordinate data. Negative screen coordinates may be returned on multiple monitor systems.

summary.para: Adds item data to the list box at the specified location. You can use this macro or send the LB_ADDSTRING message explicitly.

param.name: data
param.para: A pointer to the item data to add.

remarks.para: Use this macro for a list box with an owner-drawn style but without the LBS_HASSTRINGS style. For more information, see LB_ADDSTRING.

summary.para: Adds a string to a list box. If the list box does not have the LBS_SORT style, the string is added to the end of the list. Otherwise, the string is inserted into the list and the list is sorted. You can use this macro or send the LB_ADDSTRING message explicitly.
Deletes the item at the specified location in a list box. You can use this macro or send the LB_DELETESTRING message explicitly.

param.name: index
param.para: The zero-based index of the item to delete.

summary.para: Adds names to the list displayed by a list box. The macro adds the names of directories and files that match a specified string and set of file attributes. It can also add mapped drive letters to the list box. You can use this macro or send the LB_DIR message explicitly.

param.name: attrs
param.para: The attributes of the files or directories to be added to the list box. For more information, see LB_DIR.

param.name: lpszFileSpec
param.para: A pointer to the null-terminated string that specifies an absolute path, relative path, or filename. An absolute path can begin with a drive letter (for example, d:) or a UNC name (for example, \ machinename\ sharename).

summary.para: Enables or disables a list box control.

param.name: fEnable
param.para: TRUE to enable the control, or FALSE to disable it.

summary.para: Finds the first item in a list box that has the specified item data. You can use this macro or send the LB_FINDSTRING message explicitly.

param.name: indexStart
param.para: The zero-based index of the item before the first item to be searched. When the search reaches the bottom of the list box, it continues searching from the top of the list box back to the item specified by the indexStart parameter. If indexStart is –1, the entire list box is searched from the beginning.

summary.para: Finds the first string in a list box that begins with the specified string. You can use this macro or send the LB_FINDSTRING message explicitly.

param.name: indexStart
param.para: The zero-based index of the item before the first item to be searched. When the search reaches the bottom of the list box, it continues searching from the top of the list box back to the item specified by the indexStart parameter. If indexStart is –1, the entire list box is searched from the beginning.

summary.para: Finds the first list box string that exactly matches the specified string, except that the search is not case sensitive. You can use this macro or send the LB_FINDSTRINGEXACT message explicitly.

param.name: indexStart
param.para: The zero-based index of the item before the first item to be searched. When the search reaches the bottom of the list box, it continues searching from the top of the list box back to the item specified by the indexStart parameter. If indexStart is –1, the entire list box is searched from the beginning.

summary.para: Retrieves the index of the list box item that has the focus rectangle in a multiple-selection list box. The item may or may not be selected. You can use this macro or send the LB_GETCARETINDEX message explicitly.

remarks.para: The contents of the list box are scrolled till the item is fully visible.

summary.para: Gets the number of items in a list box. You can use this macro or send the LB_GETCOUNT message explicitly.
Gets the index of the currently selected item in a single-selection list box. You can use this macro or send the LB_GETCURSEL message explicitly.

Gets the width that a list box can be scrolled horizontally (the scrollable width) if the list box has a horizontal scroll bar. You can use this macro or send the LB_GETHORIZONTALEXTENT message explicitly.
Gets the application-defined value associated with the specified list box item. You can use this macro or send the LB_GETITEMDATA message explicitly.

param.name: index
param.para: The zero-based index of the item.

summary.para: Retrieves the height of items in a list box. If the list box has the LBS_OWNERDRAWVARIABLE style, this macro gets the height of the specified item; otherwise, it gets the height of all items. You can use this macro or send the LB_GETITEMHEIGHT message explicitly.

param.name: index
param.para: The zero-based index of the item. If the list box does not have the LBS_OWNERDRAWVARIABLE style, set this parameter to zero.

summary.para: Gets the dimensions of the rectangle that bounds a list box item as it is currently displayed in the list box. You can use this macro or send the LB_GETITEMRECT message explicitly.

param.name: index
param.para: The zero-based index of the item in the list box.

param.name: lprc
param.para: A pointer to a structure that receives the client coordinates for the item in the list box.

summary.para: Gets the selection state of an item. You can use this macro or send the LB_GETSEL message explicitly.

param.name: index
param.para: The zero-based index of the item.

summary.para: Gets the count of selected items in a multiple-selection list box. You can use this macro or send the LB_GETSELCOUNT message explicitly.
Gets the indexes of selected items in a multiple-selection list box. You can use this macro or send the LB_GETSELITEMS message explicitly.

param.name: cItems
param.para: The maximum number of selected items whose item numbers are to be placed in the buffer.

param.name: lpItems
param.para: A pointer to a buffer large enough for the number of integers specified by cItems.

summary.para: Gets a string from a list box. You can use this macro or send the LB_GETTEXT message explicitly.

param.name: index
param.para: The zero-based index of the item.

param.name: lpszBuffer
param.para: A pointer to the buffer that will receive the string. The buffer must have sufficient space for the string and a terminating null character. Before allocating the buffer, you can call to retrieve the length of the string.

summary.para: Gets the length of a string in a list box. You can use this macro or send the LB_GETTEXTLEN message explicitly.

param.name: index
param.para: The zero-based index of the item.

summary.para: Gets the index of the first visible item in a list box. You can use this macro or send the LB_GETTOPINDEX message explicitly.
Inserts item data to a list box at the specified location. You can use this macro or send the LB_INSERTSTRING message explicitly.

param.name: index
param.para: The zero-based index in the list at which to insert the item data, or –1 to add it to the end of the list.

param.name: data
param.para: A pointer to the item data to insert.

remarks.para: Use this macro for a list box with an owner-drawn style but without the LBS_HASSTRINGS style. For more information, see LB_INSERTSTRING.

summary.para: Adds a string to a list box at the specified location. You can use this macro or send the LB_INSERTSTRING message explicitly.

param.name: index
param.para: The zero-based index at which to insert the string, or –1 to add it to the end of the list.

summary.para: Removes all items from a list box. You can use this macro or send the LB_RESETCONTENT message explicitly.
Searches a list box for an item that has the specified item data. If a matching item is found, the item is selected. You can use this macro or send the LB_SELECTSTRING message explicitly.

param.name: indexStart
param.para: The zero-based index of the item before the first item to be searched. When the search reaches the bottom of the list box, it continues searching from the top of the list box back to the item specified by the indexStart parameter. If indexStart is –1, the entire list box is searched from the beginning.

summary.para: Searches a list box for an item that begins with the characters in a specified string. If a matching item is found, the item is selected. You can use this macro or send the LB_SELECTSTRING message explicitly.

param.name: indexStart
param.para: The zero-based index of the item before the first item to be searched. When the search reaches the bottom of the list box, it continues searching from the top of the list box back to the item specified by the indexStart parameter. If indexStart is –1, the entire list box is searched from the beginning.

summary.para: Selects or deselects one or more consecutive items in a multiple-selection list box. You can use this macro or send the LB_SELITEMRANGE message explicitly.

param.name: fSelect
param.para: TRUE to select the range of items, or FALSE to deselect it.

param.name: first
param.para: The zero-based index of the first item to select.

param.name: last
param.para: The zero-based index of the last item to select.

summary.para: Sets the focus rectangle to the item at the specified index in a multiple-selection list box. If the item is not visible, it is scrolled into view. You can use this macro or send the LB_SETCARETINDEX message explicitly.

param.name: index
param.para: the zero-based index of the list box item that is to receive the focus rectangle.

remarks.para: The contents of the list box are scrolled till the item is fully visible.

summary.para: Sets the width of all columns in a multiple-column list box. You can use this macro or send the LB_SETCOLUMNWIDTH message explicitly.

param.name: cxColumn
param.para: The width, in pixels, of all columns.

summary.para: Sets the currently selected item in a single-selection list box. You can use this macro or send the LB_SETCURSEL message explicitly.

param.name: index
param.para: The zero-based index of the item to select, or –1 to clear the selection.

summary.para: Set the width by which a list box can be scrolled horizontally (the scrollable width). If the width of the list box is smaller than this value, the horizontal scroll bar horizontally scrolls items in the list box. If the width of the list box is equal to or greater than this value, the horizontal scroll bar is hidden. You can use this macro or send the LB_SETHORIZONTALEXTENT message explicitly.

param.name: cxExtent
param.para: The number of pixels by which the list box can be scrolled.

summary.para: Sets the application-defined value associated with the specified list box item. You can use this macro or send the LB_SETITEMDATA message explicitly.

param.name: index
param.para: The zero-based index of the item.

summary.para: Sets the height of items in a list box. If the list box has the LBS_OWNERDRAWVARIABLE style, this macro sets the height of the specified item; otherwise, it sets the height of all items. You can use this macro or send the LB_SETITEMHEIGHT message explicitly.

param.name: index
param.para: The zero-based index of the item. If the list box does not have the LBS_OWNERDRAWVARIABLE style, set this parameter to zero.

param.name: cy
param.para: The height of the item or items, in pixels.

summary.para: Selects or deselects an item in a multiple-selection list box. You can use this macro or send the LB_SETSEL message explicitly.

param.name: fSelect
param.para: TRUE to select the item, or FALSE to deselect it.

param.name: index
param.para: The zero-based index of the item.

summary.para: Sets the tab-stop positions in a list box. You can use this macro or send the LB_SETTABSTOPS message explicitly.

param.name: cTabs
param.para: The number of elements in the lpTabs array.

param.name: lpTabs
param.para: A pointer to an array of integers containing the tab stops. The integers represent the number of quarters of the average character width for the font that is selected into the list box. For example, a tab stop of 4 is placed at 1.0 character units, and a tab stop of 6 is placed at 1.5 average character units. However, if the list box is part of a dialog box, the integers are in dialog template units. The tab stops must be sorted in ascending order; backward tabs are not allowed.

summary.para: Ensures that the specified item in a list box is visible. You can use this macro or send the LB_SETTOPINDEX message explicitly.

param.name: indexTop
param.para: The zero-based index of the item to put at the top of the visible part of the list.

remarks.para: The list box contents are scrolled so that either the specified item appears at the top of the list box or the maximum scroll range has been reached.

summary.para: Enables or disables a scroll bar control.

param.name: flags
param.para: Flags that specify the arrows affected and whether they are enabled or disabled. See the wArrows parameter of for more information.

remarks.para: The macro expands to a call to with SB_CTL in the wSBFlags parameter.

summary.para: Retrieves the position of the scroll box (thumb) in the specified scroll bar.
Note This macro expands to a call to the function, which is deprecated. New applications should use the function.
Gets the range of a scroll bar.
Note This macro expands to a call to the function, which is deprecated. New applications should use the function.

param.name: lpposMin
param.para: Address of a variable that receives the minimum value of the scroll bar.

param.name: lpposMax
param.para: Address of a variable that receives the maximum value of the scroll bar.

summary.para: Sets the position of the scroll box (thumb) in the specified scroll bar and, if requested, redraws the scroll bar to reflect the new position of the scroll box.
Note This macro expands to a call to the function, which is deprecated. New applications should use the function.

param.name: pos
param.para: The new position of the scroll box.

param.name: fRedraw
param.para: TRUE to redraw the control; otherwise FALSE.

summary.para: Sets the range of a scroll bar.
Note This macro expands to a call to the function, which is deprecated. New applications should use the function.

param.name: posMin
param.para: The minimum value of the scroll bar.

param.name: posMax
param.para: The maximum value of the scroll bar.

param.name: fRedraw
param.para: TRUE to redraw the control; otherwise FALSE.

summary.para: Shows or hides a scroll bar control.

param.name: fShow
param.para: TRUE to show the control, or FALSE to hide it.

summary.para: The SelectFont macro selects a font object into the specified device context (DC). The new font object replaces the previous font object.

param.name: hfont
param.para: A handle to the font object to be selected. The font object must have been created using either or .

remarks.para: After an application has finished drawing with the new font object, it should always replace a new font object with the original font object.
The SelectFont macro is equivalent to calling as follows:

summary.para: Enables or disables a static control.

param.name: fEnable
param.para: TRUE to enable the static control, or FALSE to disable it.

summary.para: Retrieves a handle to the icon associated with a static control that has the SS_ICON style. You can use this macro or send the STM_GETICON message explicitly.
Gets the text of a static control.

param.name: lpch
param.para: A pointer to the buffer that will receive the text.

param.name: cchMax
param.para: The maximum number of characters to copy to the buffer, including the NULL terminator.

remarks.para: The macro expands to a call to .

summary.para: Gets the number of characters in the text of a static control.

remarks.para: The macro expands to a call to .

summary.para: Sets the icon for a static control. You can use this macro or send the STM_SETICON message explicitly.
Sets the text of a static control.

param.name: lpsz
param.para: A pointer to a null-terminated string to be used as the static control text.

remarks.para: The macro expands to a call to .
